title.narrative: Twaweza: Programme support for activities in Tanzania 2016-2018
Twaweza: Programstöd för aktiviteter i Tanzania 2016-2018

description.narrative:
Twaweza har ansökt om stöd motsvarande MSEK 60 för att genomföra "Twaweza Strategy East Africa 2015-2018". Den totala budgeten för den fyraåriga strategiperioden är MUSD 81,8 fördelad över verksamhet i Tanzania, Kenya och Uganda med en ungefärlig fördelning enligt andelar 2:1:1. Åtminstone fyra givare har åtagit sig att bidra till implementeringen. Sida kommer att åta sig att bidra med MSEK 48 för genomförandet av aktiviteter i Tanzania under perioden 2016 till 2018.
Insatsen syftar till att förbättra resultaten inom grundskolan och göra staten mer öppen, lyhörd och ansvarstagande gentemot medborgarna. Detta förväntas åstadkommas genom ett stödja ett större offentligt engagemang kring policyfrågor i utbildningssektorn genom användandet olika media-strategier för att öka medvetenhet och kunskap och påverka beteende, uppfattning och agerande för utkrävande av ansvar vilket i sin tur förväntas leda till att politiker och tjänstemän utformar policys, planer och budgetar som bättre svarar mot medborgarnas efterfrågan på sociala tjänster inklusive efterfrågan på grundläggande utbildning.

Twaweza has applied to Sida for funding of 60 million SEK to carry out the "Twaweza Strategy East Africa 2015-2018". The total budget for the four-year strategic period is USD 81.8 million, divided over Tanzania, Kenya and Uganda on a ratio of approximately 2:1:1. At least 4 donor agencies have pledged or committed to support the intervention. For its part, Sida will commit 48 million SEK for the endeavor for activities in Tanzania from 2016 to 2018.
The intervention aims at improving the learning outcomes in basic education and making the government more open, responsive and accountable to the citizens. This is expected to be achieved by promoting public policy engagement and communication and use of various media strategies that will create awareness, knowledge and influence behavior, perception and action by the citizens demanding accountability, in turn leading to public officials creating policies, plans and budgets that will respond to the public demand for improved delivery of social services including basic education.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: Note that Twaweza Tanzania was granted no cost extension up to 2019 December as activity period. Also it is important to recall that, the extension came at the time when Twaweza was transitioning to a new governance strategy in Tanzania hence Twaweza's objectives broadly remain the same but slightly adjusted in the narrtaives. The achievement below is a reflection of 2019 and not 2018. Twaweza in 2019, rephrased objective to Missions. Twaweza therefore has categorized its work on three different mission. On mission one named as 'demonstrating citizen's agency', There are two stories of achievements reported for 2019. Mbogwe in Tanga and Kigoma Ujiji districts. It is reported that through partnership with an organization called TAMASHA, Twaweza trained 2 animators per village in selected wards (7 in Mbogwe and 14 in Kigoma Ujiji) to work with a newly institutionalized people’s committee to address prioritized challenges. Twaweza reports that animators are properly trained, systematically engage different stakeholders at different level, each process is documented and from time to time the animators are being mentored by TAMASHA as lead facilitator in the process. Twaweza’s report 2019 claims that there have been more positive results in Mbogwe district than in Kigoma Ujiji. More latrines, school construction and increased community awareness are evidences of Mbogwe district intervention. In Kigoma Ujiji it is reported that, the animation process didn’t go further as there were issues to be solved between Twaweza and district council. For a mission 2 that ensures citizens’ experiences and voices are heard and taken seriously in decision making; Twaweza in 2019 report has continued to deliver on its old ‘Bunge Live’ intervention as was piloted in 2017/2018. 'Bunge live' involves constituency screening, an MP for respective ward or village is brought together with her or his constituency. According to Twaweza report for 2019, conservative estimates suggest that around 60,000 have been reached in all 15 constituencies. Another activity reported on Mission 2 as a success in 2019, is Twaweza’s ability to include and invite 15 CSOs to input for Decentralization policy in Tanzania. Policy Forum, Legal and Human Rights Centre, Foundation for Civil Society and Wajibu institute played key logistical and facilitation role while Twaweza was a leading organization. Twaweza claim that this opportunity was a direct space for citizens voice to be heard. According to Twaweza, a revised decentralization policy has been shared to Twaweza by TAMISEMI and most of the CSOs comments were taken onboard. On mission 3, promoting and protecting open civic space that allows for free assembly or organize, speak and act; Twaweza 2019 reports that it has successfully led other CSOs to challenge proposed amendments on Political Parties Act and Registration of NGO and other 7 laws. According to Twaweza, 15 of 51 CSOs recommendations were taken onboard after a series of interrupted and unfriendly difficult advocacy processes. For registration of NGOs, the significant achievement was the amended NGO definition and scope to include governance and Human Rights. The report also shades positive light on brutal conducts of an organized gang in Kigoma Ujiji who invaded women houses to rape them. According to Twaweza, it seems such acts were happening as from 2015 but citizens and local village authorities were threatened not to speak. Twaweza in collaboration with TAMASHA, LHRC decided to launch a rapid fact-finding mission in claimed villages and used the facts to engage with Minister of Home Affairs and Kigoma regional authorities. The campaign was wide, ringleader was arrested and released for lack of evidence.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
